pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:0.5: 44. The training rule on lifted balls of food
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate from lifted balls of food. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.3.1: “‘I will not eat from a lifted ball of food,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.4: One should not eat from a lifted ball of food.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats from a lifted ball of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.12: if it is any kind of fruit;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.15: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.16: The fourth training rule is finished.
